intro: Oxygyne duncanii, commonly known as Duncan's oxygyne, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and sorrel. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils in arid environments. Oxygyne duncanii is often found in desert scrub and chaparral habitats, where it thrives in full sun.
